prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a square-based pyramid with a square top and a flat bottom. Step 1: Define the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. Step 3: Create faces and loops 1. Create the base of the pyramid: - Face 1: - Loop 1: - Line 1: Starting at (0.0, 0.0), ending at (0.75, 0.0). - Line 2: Starting at (0.75, 0.0), ending at (0.75, 0.75). - Line 3: Starting at (0.75, 0.75), ending at (0.0, 0.75). - Line 4: Starting at (0.0, 0.75), ending at (0.0, 0.0). 2. Create a loop for the pyramid's top: - Face 1: - Loop 2: - Line 1: Starting at (0.1276, 0.375), ending at (0.2513, 0.1607). - Line 2: Starting at (0.2513, 0.1607), ending at (0.4987, 0.1607). - Line 3: Starting at (0.4987, 0.1607), ending at (0.6224, 0.375). - Line 4: Starting at (0.6224, 0.375), ending at (0.4987, 0.5893). - Line 5: Starting at (0.4987, 0.5893), ending at (0.2513, 0.5893). - Line 6: Starting at (0.2513, 0.5893), ending at (0.1276, 0.375). Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch uniformly by a factor of 0.75. Step 5: Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch Apply the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the sketch along the normal direction by: - Extrusion depth towards normal: 0.2143 - Extrusion depth opposite normal: 0.0 Using the scaling parameter: - Sketch scale: 0.75 Step 7: Finalize the part This part represents a square-based pyramid with a square top and a flat bottom. The measurements are as follows: - Length (square side): 0.75 - Width (square side): 0.2143 - Height (square side): 0.75</description>
